src/EventStreamHttpReader.cc

00001 /*
00002   Input source for event consumers that will get events from the
00003   Storage Manager Event Server. This does uses a HTTP get using the
00004   cURL library. The Storage Manager Event Server responses with
00005   a binary octet-stream.  The product registry is also obtained
00006   through a HTTP get.
00007       There is currently no test of the product registry against
00008   the consumer client product registry within the code. It should
00009   already be done if this was inherenting from the standard
00010   framework input source. Currently we inherit from InputSource.
00011 
00012   17 Mar 2006 - HWKC - initial version for testing
00013   30 Mar 2006 - HWKC - first proof of principle version that can
00014                 wait for the the product registry and events from
00015                 the Storage Manager. Only way to stop the cmsRun
00016                 using this input source is to kill the Storage
00017                 Manager or specify a maximum number of events for
00018                 the client to read through a maxEvents parameter.
00019 
00020   $Id: EventStreamHttpReader.cc,v 1.31.12.1 2009/01/27 18:29:10 biery Exp $
00021 */
00022 
00023 #include "EventFilter/StorageManager/src/EventStreamHttpReader.h"
00024 #include "EventFilter/StorageManager/interface/SMCurlInterface.h"

00045   EventStreamHttpReader::EventStreamHttpReader(edm::ParameterSet const& ps,
00046                  edm::InputSourceDescription const& desc):
00047     edm::StreamerInputSource(ps, desc),
00048     sourceurl_(ps.getParameter<string>("sourceURL")),
00049     buf_(1000*1000*7), 
00050     endRunAlreadyNotified_(true),
00051     runEnded_(false),
00052     alreadySaidHalted_(false),
00053     maxConnectTries_(DEFAULT_MAX_CONNECT_TRIES),
00054     connectTrySleepTime_(DEFAULT_CONNECT_TRY_SLEEP_TIME)
00055   {
00056     // Retry connection params (wb)
00057     maxConnectTries_ = ps.getUntrackedParameter<int>("maxConnectTries",
00058                  DEFAULT_MAX_CONNECT_TRIES);
00059     connectTrySleepTime_ = ps.getUntrackedParameter<int>("connectTrySleepTime",
00060                  DEFAULT_CONNECT_TRY_SLEEP_TIME);
00061 
00062     std::string evturl = sourceurl_ + "/geteventdata";
00063     int stlen = evturl.length();
00064     for (int i=0; i<stlen; i++) eventurl_[i]=evturl[i];
00065     eventurl_[stlen] = '\0';
00066 
00067     std::string header = sourceurl_ + "/getregdata";
00068     stlen = header.length();
00069     for (int i=0; i<stlen; i++) headerurl_[i]=header[i];
00070     headerurl_[stlen] = '\0';
00071 
00072     std::string regurl = sourceurl_ + "/registerConsumer";
00073     stlen = regurl.length();
00074     for (int i=0; i<stlen; i++) subscriptionurl_[i]=regurl[i];
00075     subscriptionurl_[stlen] = '\0';
00076 
00077     // 09-Aug-2006, KAB: new parameters
00078     const double MAX_REQUEST_INTERVAL = 300.0;  // seconds
00079     consumerName_ = ps.getUntrackedParameter<string>("consumerName","Unknown");
00080     consumerPriority_ = ps.getUntrackedParameter<string>("consumerPriority","normal");
00081     headerRetryInterval_ = ps.getUntrackedParameter<int>("headerRetryInterval",5);
00082     double maxEventRequestRate = ps.getUntrackedParameter<double>("maxEventRequestRate",1.0);
00083     if (maxEventRequestRate < (1.0 / MAX_REQUEST_INTERVAL)) {
00084       minEventRequestInterval_ = MAX_REQUEST_INTERVAL;
00085     }
00086     else {
00087       minEventRequestInterval_ = 1.0 / maxEventRequestRate;  // seconds
00088     }
00089     lastRequestTime_.tv_sec = 0;
00090     lastRequestTime_.tv_usec = 0;
00091 
00092     // 26-Jan-2009, KAB: an ugly hack to get ParameterSet to serialize
00093     // the parameters that we need
00094     ParameterSet psCopy(ps.toString());
00095     psCopy.addParameter<double>("TrackedMaxRate", maxEventRequestRate);
00096     std::string hltOMLabel = ps.getUntrackedParameter<std::string>("SelectHLTOutput",
00097                                                                    std::string());
00098     psCopy.addParameter<std::string>("TrackedHLTOutMod", hltOMLabel);
00099     edm::ParameterSet selectEventsParamSet =
00100       ps.getUntrackedParameter("SelectEvents", edm::ParameterSet());
00101     if (! selectEventsParamSet.empty()) {
00102       Strings path_specs = 
00103         selectEventsParamSet.getParameter<Strings>("SelectEvents");
00104       if (! path_specs.empty()) {
00105         psCopy.addParameter<Strings>("TrackedEventSelection", path_specs);
00106       }
00107     }
00108 
00109     // 28-Aug-2006, KAB: save our parameter set in string format to
00110     // be sent to the event server to specify our "request" (that is, which
00111     // events we are interested in).
00112     consumerPSetString_ = psCopy.toString();
00113 
00114     // 16-Aug-2006, KAB: register this consumer with the event server
00115     consumerId_ = (time(0) & 0xffffff);  // temporary - will get from ES later
00116     registerWithEventServer();
00117 
00118     readHeader();
00119   }
00120 
00121   EventStreamHttpReader::~EventStreamHttpReader()
00122   {
00123   }
00124 
00125   std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal> EventStreamHttpReader::read()
00126   {
00127     // repeat a http get every N seconds until we get an event
00128     // wait for Storage Manager event server buffer to not be empty
00129     // only way to stop is specify a maxEvents parameter
00130     // or kill the Storage Manager so the http get fails.
00131 
00132     // try to get an event repeat until we get one, this allows
00133     // re-registration if the SM is halted or stopped
00134 
00135     bool gotEvent = false;
00136     std::auto_ptr<EventPrincipal> result(0);
00137     while ((!gotEvent) && (!runEnded_) && (!edm::shutdown_flag))
00138     {
00139        result = getOneEvent();
00140        if(result.get() != NULL) gotEvent = true;
00141     }
00142     // need next line so we only return a null pointer once for each end of run
00143     if(runEnded_) runEnded_ = false;
00144     return result;
00145   }
00146 
00147   std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal> EventStreamHttpReader::getOneEvent()
00148   {
00149     // repeat a http get every N seconds until we get an event
00150     // wait for Storage Manager event server buffer to not be empty
00151     // only way to stop is specify a maxEvents parameter or cntrol-c.
00152     // If the Storage Manager is killed so the http get fails, we
00153     // end the job as we would be in an unknown state (If SM is up
00154     // and we have a network problem we just try to get another event,
00155     // but if SM is killed/dead we want to register.)
00156 
00157     // check if we need to sleep (to enforce the allowed request rate)
00158     struct timeval now;
00159     struct timezone dummyTZ;
00160     gettimeofday(&now, &dummyTZ);
00161     double timeDiff = (double) now.tv_sec;
00162     timeDiff -= (double) lastRequestTime_.tv_sec;
00163     timeDiff += ((double) now.tv_usec / 1000000.0);
00164     timeDiff -= ((double) lastRequestTime_.tv_usec / 1000000.0);
00165     if (timeDiff < minEventRequestInterval_)
00166     {
00167       double sleepTime = minEventRequestInterval_ - timeDiff;
00168       // trim off a little sleep time to account for the time taken by
00169       // calling gettimeofday again
00170       sleepTime -= 0.01;
00171       if (sleepTime < 0.0) {sleepTime = 0.0;}
00172       //cout << "sleeping for " << sleepTime << endl;
00173       usleep(static_cast<int>(1000000 * sleepTime));
00174       gettimeofday(&lastRequestTime_, &dummyTZ);
00175     }
00176     else
00177     {
00178       lastRequestTime_ = now;
00179     }
00180 
00181     stor::ReadData data;
00182     bool alreadySaidWaiting = false;
00183     do {
00184       CURL* han = curl_easy_init();
00185 
00186       if(han==0)
00187       {
00188         cerr << "could not create handle" << endl;
00189         // this will end cmsRun 
00190         //return std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal>();
00191         throw cms::Exception("getOneEvent","EventStreamHttpReader")
00192             << "Could not get event: problem with curl"
00193             << "\n";
00194       }
00195 
00196       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_URL,eventurl_);
00197       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION,stor::func);
00198       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEDATA,&data);
00199 
00200       // 24-Aug-2006, KAB: send our consumer ID as part of the event request
00201       char msgBuff[100];
00202       OtherMessageBuilder requestMessage(&msgBuff[0], Header::EVENT_REQUEST,
00203                                          sizeof(char_uint32));
00204       uint8 *bodyPtr = requestMessage.msgBody();
00205       convert(consumerId_, bodyPtr);
00206       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, requestMessage.startAddress());
00207       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDSIZE, requestMessage.size());
00208       struct curl_slist *headers=NULL;
00209       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Type: application/octet-stream");
00210       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary");
00211       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, headers);
00212 
00213       // send the HTTP POST, read the reply, and cleanup before going on
00214       CURLcode messageStatus = curl_easy_perform(han);
00215       curl_slist_free_all(headers);
00216       curl_easy_cleanup(han);
00217 
00218       if(messageStatus!=0)
00219       {
00220         cerr << "curl perform failed for event, messageStatus = "
00221              << messageStatus << endl;
00222         // this will end cmsRun 
00223         //return std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal>();
00224         throw cms::Exception("getOneEvent","EventStreamHttpReader")
00225             << "Could not get event: probably XDAQ not running on Storage Manager "
00226             << "\n";
00227       }
00228       if(data.d_.length() == 0)
00229       {
00230         if(!alreadySaidWaiting) {
00231           std::cout << "...waiting for event from Storage Manager..." << std::endl;
00232           alreadySaidWaiting = true;
00233         }
00234         // sleep for the standard request interval
00235         usleep(static_cast<int>(1000000 * minEventRequestInterval_));
00236       }
00237     } while (data.d_.length() == 0 && !edm::shutdown_flag);
00238     if (edm::shutdown_flag) {
00239   return std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal>();
00240     }
00241 
00242     int len = data.d_.length();
00243     FDEBUG(9) << "EventStreamHttpReader received len = " << len << std::endl;
00244     buf_.resize(len);
00245     for (int i=0; i<len ; i++) buf_[i] = data.d_[i];
00246 
00247     // first check if done message
00248     OtherMessageView msgView(&buf_[0]);
00249 
00250     if (msgView.code() == Header::DONE) {
00251       // no need to register again as the SM/EventServer is kept alive on a stopAction
00252       // *BUT* for a haltAction, we need a code to say when SM is halted as then we need 
00253       // register again else the consumerId is wrong and we may get wrong events!
00254       // We may even need to end the job if a new run has new triggers, etc.
00255       if(!alreadySaidHalted_) {
00256         alreadySaidHalted_ = true;
00257         std::cout << "Storage Manager has stopped - waiting for restart" << std::endl;
00258         std::cout << "Warning! If you are waiting forever at: "
00259                   << "...waiting for event from Storage Manager... " << std::endl
00260                   << "   it may be that the Storage Manager has been halted with a haltAction," << std::endl
00261                   << "   instead of a stopAction. In this case you should control-c to end " << std::endl
00262                   << "   this consumer and restart it. (This will be fixed in a future update)" << std::endl;
00263       }
00264       // decide if we need to notify that a run has ended
00265       if(!endRunAlreadyNotified_) {
00266         endRunAlreadyNotified_ = true;
00267         setEndRun();
00268         runEnded_ = true;
00269       }
00270       return std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal>();
00271     } else {
00272       // reset need-to-set-end-run flag when we get the first event (here any event)
00273       endRunAlreadyNotified_ = false;
00274       alreadySaidHalted_ = false;
00275 
00276       // 29-Jan-2008, KAB:  catch (and re-throw) any exceptions decoding
00277       // the event data so that we can display the returned HTML and
00278       // (hopefully) give the user a hint as to the cause of the problem.
00279       std::auto_ptr<edm::EventPrincipal> evtPtr;
00280       try {
00281         HeaderView hdrView(&buf_[0]);
00282         if (hdrView.code() != Header::EVENT) {
00283           throw cms::Exception("EventStreamHttpReader", "readOneEvent");
00284         }
00285         EventMsgView eventView(&buf_[0]);
00286         evtPtr = deserializeEvent(eventView);
00287       }
00288       catch (cms::Exception excpt) {
00289         const unsigned int MAX_DUMP_LENGTH = 2000;
00290         std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00291         std::cout << "* Exception decoding the geteventdata response from the storage manager!" << std::endl;
00292         if (data.d_.length() <= MAX_DUMP_LENGTH) {
00293           std::cout << "* Here is the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00294           std::cout << data.d_ << std::endl;
00295         }
00296         else {
00297           std::cout << "* Here are the first " << MAX_DUMP_LENGTH <<
00298             " characters of the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00299           std::cout << (data.d_.substr(0, MAX_DUMP_LENGTH)) << std::endl;
00300         }
00301         std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00302         throw excpt;
00303       }
00304       return evtPtr;
00305     }
00306   }
00307 
00308   void EventStreamHttpReader::readHeader()
00309   {
00310     // repeat a http get every 5 seconds until we get the registry
00311     // do it like this for pull mode
00312     bool alreadySaidWaiting = false;
00313     stor::ReadData data;
00314     do {
00315       CURL* han = curl_easy_init();
00316 
00317       if(han==0)
00318         {
00319           cerr << "could not create handle" << endl;
00320           //return 0; //or use this?
00321           throw cms::Exception("readHeader","EventStreamHttpReader")
00322             << "Could not get header: probably XDAQ not running on Storage Manager "
00323             << "\n";
00324         }
00325 
00326       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_URL,headerurl_);
00327       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION,stor::func);
00328       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEDATA,&data);
00329 
00330       // 10-Aug-2006, KAB: send our consumer ID as part of the header request
00331       char msgBuff[100];
00332       OtherMessageBuilder requestMessage(&msgBuff[0], Header::HEADER_REQUEST,
00333                                          sizeof(char_uint32));
00334       uint8 *bodyPtr = requestMessage.msgBody();
00335       convert(consumerId_, bodyPtr);
00336       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, requestMessage.startAddress());
00337       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDSIZE, requestMessage.size());
00338       struct curl_slist *headers=NULL;
00339       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Type: application/octet-stream");
00340       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary");
00341       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, headers);
00342 
00343       // send the HTTP POST, read the reply, and cleanup before going on
00344       CURLcode messageStatus = curl_easy_perform(han);
00345       curl_slist_free_all(headers);
00346       curl_easy_cleanup(han);
00347 
00348       if(messageStatus!=0)
00349       {
00350         cerr << "curl perform failed for header" << endl;
00351         // do not retry curl here as we should return to registration instead if we
00352         // want an automatic recovery
00353         throw cms::Exception("readHeader","EventStreamHttpReader")
00354           << "Could not get header: probably XDAQ not running on Storage Manager "
00355           << "\n";
00356       }
00357       if(data.d_.length() == 0)
00358       {
00359         if(!alreadySaidWaiting) {
00360           std::cout << "...waiting for header from Storage Manager..." << std::endl;
00361           alreadySaidWaiting = true;
00362         }
00363         // sleep for desired amount of time
00364         sleep(headerRetryInterval_);
00365       }
00366     } while (data.d_.length() == 0 && !edm::shutdown_flag);
00367     if (edm::shutdown_flag) {
00368       throw cms::Exception("readHeader","EventStreamHttpReader")
00369           << "The header read was aborted by a shutdown request.\n";
00370     }
00371 
00372     std::vector<char> regdata(1000*1000);
00373 
00374     // rely on http transfer string of correct length!
00375     int len = data.d_.length();
00376     FDEBUG(9) << "EventStreamHttpReader received registry len = " << len << std::endl;
00377     regdata.resize(len);
00378     for (int i=0; i<len ; i++) regdata[i] = data.d_[i];
00379     // 21-Jun-2006, KAB:  catch (and re-throw) any exceptions decoding
00380     // the job header so that we can display the returned HTML and
00381     // (hopefully) give the user a hint as to the cause of the problem.
00382     std::auto_ptr<SendJobHeader> p;
00383     try {
00384       HeaderView hdrView(&regdata[0]);
00385       if (hdrView.code() != Header::INIT) {
00386         throw cms::Exception("EventStreamHttpReader", "readHeader");
00387       }
00388       InitMsgView initView(&regdata[0]);
00389       deserializeAndMergeWithRegistry(initView);
00390     }
00391     catch (cms::Exception excpt) {
00392       const unsigned int MAX_DUMP_LENGTH = 1000;
00393       std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00394       std::cout << "* Exception decoding the getregdata response from the storage manager!" << std::endl;
00395       if (data.d_.length() <= MAX_DUMP_LENGTH) {
00396         std::cout << "* Here is the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00397         std::cout << data.d_ << std::endl;
00398       }
00399       else {
00400         std::cout << "* Here are the first " << MAX_DUMP_LENGTH <<
00401           " characters of the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00402         std::cout << (data.d_.substr(0, MAX_DUMP_LENGTH)) << std::endl;
00403       }
00404       std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00405       throw excpt;
00406     }
00407   }
00408 
00409   void EventStreamHttpReader::registerWithEventServer()
00410   {
00411     stor::ReadData data;
00412     uint32 registrationStatus = ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY;
00413     bool alreadySaidWaiting = false;
00414     do {
00415       data.d_.clear();
00416       CURL* han = curl_easy_init();
00417       if(han==0)
00418         {
00419           cerr << "could not create handle" << endl;
00420           throw cms::Exception("registerWithEventServer","EventStreamHttpReader")
00421             << "Unable to create curl handle\n";
00422         }
00423 
00424       // set the standard http request options
00425       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_URL,subscriptionurl_);
00426       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEFUNCTION,stor::func);
00427       stor::setopt(han,CURLOPT_WRITEDATA,&data);
00428 
00429       // build the registration request message to send to the storage manager
00430       const int BUFFER_SIZE = 2000;
00431       char msgBuff[BUFFER_SIZE];
00432       ConsRegRequestBuilder requestMessage(msgBuff, BUFFER_SIZE, consumerName_,
00433                                        consumerPriority_, consumerPSetString_);
00434 
00435       // add the request message as a http post
00436       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDS, requestMessage.startAddress());
00437       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_POSTFIELDSIZE, requestMessage.size());
00438       struct curl_slist *headers=NULL;
00439       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Type: application/octet-stream");
00440       headers = curl_slist_append(headers, "Content-Transfer-Encoding: binary");
00441       stor::setopt(han, CURLOPT_HTTPHEADER, headers);
00442 
00443       // send the HTTP POST, read the reply, and cleanup before going on
00444       //CURLcode messageStatus = (CURLcode)-1;
00445       // set messageStatus to a non-zero (but still within CURLcode enum list)
00446       CURLcode messageStatus = CURLE_COULDNT_CONNECT;
00447       int tries = 0;
00448       while (messageStatus!=0 && !edm::shutdown_flag)
00449       {
00450   tries++;
00451   messageStatus = curl_easy_perform(han);
00452   if ( messageStatus != 0 )
00453   {
00454     if ( tries >= maxConnectTries_ )
00455     {
00456       std::cerr << "Giving up waiting for connection after " << tries 
00457           << " tries"  << std::endl;
00458       curl_slist_free_all(headers);
00459       curl_easy_cleanup(han);
00460       cerr << "curl perform failed for registration" << endl;
00461       throw cms::Exception("registerWithEventServer","EventStreamHttpReader")
00462         << "Could not register: probably XDAQ not running on Storage Manager "
00463         << "\n";
00464     }
00465     else
00466     {
00467       std::cout << "Waiting for connection to StorageManager... " 
00468           << tries << "/" << maxConnectTries_
00469           << std::endl;
00470       sleep(connectTrySleepTime_);
00471     }
00472   }
00473       }
00474       if (edm::shutdown_flag) {
00475     continue;
00476       }
00477 
00478       curl_slist_free_all(headers);
00479       curl_easy_cleanup(han);
00480 
00481       registrationStatus = ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY;
00482       if(data.d_.length() > 0)
00483       {
00484         int len = data.d_.length();
00485         FDEBUG(9) << "EventStreamHttpReader received len = " << len << std::endl;
00486         buf_.resize(len);
00487         for (int i=0; i<len ; i++) buf_[i] = data.d_[i];
00488 
00489         try {
00490           ConsRegResponseView respView(&buf_[0]);
00491           registrationStatus = respView.getStatus();
00492           consumerId_ = respView.getConsumerId();
00493         }
00494         catch (cms::Exception excpt) {
00495           const unsigned int MAX_DUMP_LENGTH = 1000;
00496           std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00497           std::cout << "* Exception decoding the registerWithEventServer response!" << std::endl;
00498           if (data.d_.length() <= MAX_DUMP_LENGTH) {
00499             std::cout << "* Here is the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00500             std::cout << data.d_ << std::endl;
00501           }
00502           else {
00503             std::cout << "* Here are the first " << MAX_DUMP_LENGTH <<
00504               " characters of the raw text that was returned:" << std::endl;
00505             std::cout << (data.d_.substr(0, MAX_DUMP_LENGTH)) << std::endl;
00506           }
00507           std::cout << "========================================" << std::endl;
00508           throw excpt;
00509         }
00510       }
00511 
00512       if (registrationStatus == ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY)
00513       {
00514         if(!alreadySaidWaiting) {
00515           std::cout << "...waiting for registration response from Storage Manager..." << std::endl;
00516           alreadySaidWaiting = true;
00517         }
00518         // sleep for desired amount of time
00519         sleep(headerRetryInterval_);
00520       }
00521     } while (registrationStatus == ConsRegResponseBuilder::ES_NOT_READY &&
00522              !edm::shutdown_flag);
00523     if (edm::shutdown_flag) {
00524       throw cms::Exception("registerWithEventServer","EventStreamHttpReader")
00525           << "Registration was aborted by a shutdown request.\n";
00526     }
00527 
00528     FDEBUG(5) << "Consumer ID = " << consumerId_ << endl;
00529   }
00530 }
Generated on Fri Jan 30 12:00:43 2009 for StorageManager by  1.5.6
